testUtterance: Este texto está destinado a comprobar si estas voces en español suenan tan bien como deberían.

voices.label: Marisol (España)
voices.name: Marisol
voices.note: This voice can be installed on all Apple devices and offers two variants. Like all voices that can be installed on Apple devices, it suffers from inconsistent naming due to localization.

voices.label: Mónica (España)
voices.name: Mónica (mejorada)
voices.note: While this is meant to identify the highest quality variant for the voice, it can be difficult to do so due to inconsistencies in how voices are exposed to browsers through the Web Speech API. Since the lowest quality of the voice is pre-loaded on Apple devices, the situation is worse than with other voices that need to be installed.

voices.label: Voz Google masculina (España)
voices.name: Google español
voices.note: This voice is pre-loaded in Chrome on desktop. Utterances that are longer than 14 seconds long can trigger a bug with this voice, check the notes in the project's README for more information.

voices.label: Voz Google femenina (Estados Unidos)
voices.name: Google español de Estados Unidos
voices.note: This voice is pre-loaded in Chrome on desktop. Utterances that are longer than 14 seconds long can trigger a bug with this voice, check the notes in the project's README for more information.

voices.label: Helena (España)
voices.name: Microsoft Helena - Spanish (Spain)
voices.note: This voices is pre-loaded in Windows 10 and 11. While it's nowhere nearly as good as Microsoft's Natural Voices, it's good to have this voice listed as a fallback

voices.label: Laura (España)
voices.name: Microsoft Laura - Spanish (Spain)
voices.note: This voices is pre-loaded in Windows 10 and 11. While it's nowhere nearly as good as Microsoft's Natural Voices, it's good to have this voice listed as a fallback

voices.label: Mónica (España)
voices.name: Mónica
voices.note: This entry is meant to identify the pre-loaded variant of the voice, but it might not work on all browsers. In some cases, the previous entry might be the one detecting the pre-loaded variant unfortunately.

voices.label: Paulina (México)
voices.name: Paulina
voices.note: This entry is meant to identify the pre-loaded variant of the voice, but it might not work on all browsers. In some cases, the previous entry might be the one detecting the pre-loaded variant unfortunately.

voices.label: Voz femenina 1 (España)
voices.name: Android Speech Recognition and Synthesis from Google es-es-x-eee-local
voices.note: This pre-loaded voice on ChromeOS is tied to the Android compatibility layer and requires network access for this version, which is very much a requirement for using Chrome OS anyway. Fallbacks to natural voice as well.

voices.label: Voz femenina 2 (España)
voices.name: Android Speech Recognition and Synthesis from Google es-es-x-eea-network
voices.note: This pre-loaded voice on ChromeOS is tied to the Android compatibility layer and requires network access for this version, which is very much a requirement for using Chrome OS anyway. Fallbacks to natural voice and offline variant as well.
altNames: Android Speech Recognition and Synthesis from Google es-es-x-eea-local

voices.name: Android Speech Recognition and Synthesis from Google es-es-x-eec-network

altNames: Android Speech Recognition and Synthesis from Google es-es-x-eec-local

voices.label: Voz de España
voices.name: español España
voices.note: On Android, voice selection is only supported at a system level and Web Speech API doesn't return a true list of voices available, just a list of languages and regions
